sentence.Network_en: This research has enriched the generative theory of multimedia learning.

sentence.Network_en: It must be alloyed with more creative, generative processes to accomplish much.

sentence.Network_en: Generative Semantics was developed as a reaction to Chomsky's syntactic - based TG Grammar.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from late Latin generativus, from generare 'beget' (see generate)

entry.tran: 能生产的；有生产能力的；促使…生成的
entry.def: If something is generative, it is capable of producing something or causing it to develop.

In linguistics, generative is used to describe linguistic theories or models which are based on the idea that a single set of rules can explain how all the possible sentences of a language are formed.

means.word_mean: 1. having the ability to produce or originate;

sentences.sentence: "tXsXwhe reproductive potential of a species is its relative capacity to reproduce itself under optimal conditions"
